Avocado Pasta with Lemon Parmesan Chicken Patties

Prep: 20 min Cook: 15 min Servings: 3-4
pasta chicken dinner

Ingredients

For the Lemon Parmesan Chicken Patties

For the Avocado Pasta Sauce

Instructions

Prepare the Chicken Patties

  1. Combine ground chicken (350g), crushed garlic (2 cloves), lemon zest (1 tbsp), lemon juice (¾ tsp), Parmesan (35g), breadcrumbs (30g), egg, oregano (¾ tsp), thyme (¾ tsp), parsley (1½ tbsp), salt (⅓ tsp), and pepper (⅕ tsp) in a large bowl. Mix until just combined.
  2. With wet hands, form mixture into 3 patties and place on parchment-lined plate.
  3. Heat large non-stick pan over medium-high heat, add splash of olive oil. Cook patties 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through (internal temp 74°C). Remove from pan and rest 5 minutes.

Make the Avocado Sauce

  1. While patties cook, make sauce directly in serving bowl: Finely chop garlic (1 clove) and chili, add to bowl.
  2. Squeeze lime juice into bowl with garlic and chili.
  3. Halve avocados, remove pits, cube in shell and scoop out with spoon into bowl.
  4. Finely chop herbs and grate cheeses (Pecorino and Parmesan), add to bowl along with salt, pepper, and olive oil (50ml).
  5. Mix with spoon and taste - must have enough salt or it will be bland.

Cook Pasta and Assemble

  1. Cook spaghetti (400g) al dente (about 80% of package time) in well-salted water. Reserve about 100ml pasta water before draining.
  2. Add splash of pasta water to sauce, toss spaghetti with avocado sauce until well coated.
  3. Slice chicken patties and arrange on top of pasta.
  4. Top with more Parmesan and freshly ground black pepper, serve immediately.

Notes

This combines the fresh, creamy avocado pasta sauce with protein-rich chicken patties for a complete meal. The lemon in the chicken patties complements the lime in the avocado sauce beautifully.

Tips:

  • Make sure avocados are perfectly ripe for the best sauce
  • The chicken patties can be made ahead and reheated
  • For a lighter version, make just the avocado pasta without the chicken
  • Note: The original Finnish recipe doesn't specify exact quantities for most sauce ingredients - adjust to taste
